title: Heavy showers above 100mm likely at some places today
byline: Under the influence of the Easterly wave, the prevailing showery conditions over the Northern and Eastern parts of the island are expected to continue further during the next few days.

title: Donald Trump expands travel ban and restrictions to include an additional 20 countries
byline: The Trump administration announced Tuesday it was expanding travel restrictions to an additional 20 countries and the Palestinian Authority, doubling the number of nations affected by sweeping limits announced earlier this year on who can travel and emigrate to the U.S.

title: Vice Chairman of Standing Committee of National People’s Congress of China arrives in Sri Lanka
byline: Wang Dongming, the Vice Chairman of the Standing Committee of the National People’s Congress of China, has arrived in Sri Lanka on an official visit.

title: Foreign-made firearm and ammunition recovered based on Kehelbaddara Padme’s testimony
byline: A foreign-manufactured firearm and a stock of ammunition have been recovered based on information revealed during the interrogation of an underworld gang member known as “Kehelbaddara Padme”, who is currently being held under a detention order.

title: Turkish Airlines flight safely returns to BIA after technical issue
byline: A Turkish Airlines aircraft that departed from the Bandaranaike International Airport bound for Istanbul, Turkey, last night was able to make a safe return and land at the BIA after experiencing a technical fault in its landing gear system.

title: Individual arrested at BIA with foreign cigarettes worth over Rs. 2.85 mln
byline: An individual has been arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) while attempting to smuggle a stock of foreign-made cigarettes valued at approximately Rs. 2.85 million into the country.

title: Advisory issued for heavy rain for several provinces
byline: An ‘Amber’ advisory has been issued by the Department of Meteorology for heavy rain in the Eastern, Central, Uva Provinces and Polonnaruwa District.

title: Former Sri Lanka Test Cricketer and ex-SLC Chairman D.S. de Silva passes away
byline: Former Sri Lankan leg-spinner D. S. de Silva, a distinguished member of Sri Lanka’s inaugural Test cricket team in 1982, has passed away at the age of 83.

title: Govt to allocate Rs. 150 million to implement e-Court Project
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to the proposal to provide Rs. 150 million to the Judicial Service Commission from the provisions allocated under the Clean Sri Lanka Project to implement the e-Court Project to Digitize the Judicial System.

title: Japan to give $2.5 million in emergency aid to Sri Lanka
byline: The Japanese government decided to extend an emergency grant of $2.5 million to cyclone-hit Sri Lanka, Foreign Minister Toshimitsu Motegi said Tuesday.

title: Another aid shipment from India arrives
byline: Another shipment of dry rations has been brought from India to provide relief to people affected by the cyclone “Ditwah”.

title: Probe underway on police conduct in accident involving MP Asoka Ranwala
byline: An investigation is currently underway on the orders of the Inspector General of Police (IGP) to determine whether there was any dereliction of duty by police officers in connection with the road accident involving National People’s Power (NPP) Gampaha District Member of Parliament Asoka Ranwala,...

title: Husband axed to death by wife in Valaichchenai
byline: A 46-year-old man sustained serious injuries after being attacked with an axe in the Valaichchenai–Vahaneri area and succumbed to his injuries at the scene, police said.

title: NBRO conducts special inspections of landslide-risk schools in Central Province
byline: The National Building Research Organization (NBRO) has commenced special inspections of schools in the Central Province that are at risk of landslides due to adverse weather conditions caused by Cyclone ‘Ditwah’.

title: Schools in six provinces to reopen today
byline: The second phase of the third school term for this year will commence today (16) for all government and government-approved private schools and Pirivenas.

title: Son of filmmaker Rob Reiner jailed on suspicion of murdering parents
byline: The son of Hollywood actor and filmmaker Rob Reiner has been jailed as a suspect in the killing of his parents after they were found dead in their home over the weekend, Los Angeles police said on Monday.

title: PM highlights global support for Sri Lanka’s recovery efforts in meetings with foreign envoys
byline: The Ambassador of the Republic of Kazakhstan to Sri Lanka, Sergey Viktorov, paid a courtesy call on Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya at Temple Trees.

title: FBI arrests four people it says were planning to detonate pipe bombs on New Year’s Eve in California
byline: The Justice Department on Monday said it has arrested four people in the Los Angeles area for allegedly working together on a bomb plot that was set to take place around the city on New Year’s Eve.

title: Inginimitiya Reservoir spill gates to be opened – Irrigation Dept.
byline: The Irrigation Department announces that it is planned to release 1,000 cubic feet of water per second from the Inginimitiya reservoir at around 7.30 a.m. today (16).

title: CHEC Port City Colombo donates Rs. 10M, provides critical support for Sri Lanka’s recovery
byline: As Sri Lanka grapples with the devastating aftermath of Cyclone Ditwah, CHEC Port City Colombo (Pvt) Ltd., the project company of Port City Colombo, has stepped forward to support the nation’s recovery efforts with both financial and on-ground assistance.

title: Police Sergeant dies after being hit by speeding motorcycle
byline: A Police Sergeant attached to the Welipenna Police Station has reportedly died after being struck by a speeding motorcycle on the Aluthgama-Mathugama road, the Welipenna Police confirmed.

title: Sri Lanka has entered second phase of post-disaster recovery – PM Harini
byline: The newly appointed High Commissioner of Canada to Sri Lanka, Isabelle Catherine Martin, has conveyed Canada’s condolences over the devastation caused by Cyclone Ditwah and reaffirmed Canada’s readiness to extend further support to Sri Lanka during the recovery process.

title: Tourist arrivals exceed 2.2 million this year
byline: A total of over 2.2 million tourists have reportedly arrived in the country so far this year.

title: People living in low-lying areas of Kaudulla Reservoir urged to remain vigilant
byline: The Department of Irrigation has announced that it expects to open the spill gates of the Kaudulla Reservoir shortly.

title: BBC says will fight Trump’s US$10 billion defamation lawsuit
byline: The BBC said on Tuesday (Dec 16) it would fight a US$10 billion lawsuit brought by United States President Donald Trump against the British broadcaster over a documentary that edited his 2021 speech ahead of the US Capitol riot.

title: Sri Lanka to co-host Asian Regional Debt Management Conference
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to co-host the 2026 Asian Regional Debt Management Conference in Sri Lanka.

title: Bondi gunman’s Indian family had no knowledge of his radicalisation, Indian police say
byline: Indian police said on Tuesday that the dead gunman in Australia’s Bondi beach shooting incident, Sajid Akram, was originally from the southern Indian city of Hyderabad but had limited contact with his family in India.

title: RDA incurs Rs. 75 billion loss due to roads and bridges destroyed by disaster
byline: Officials of the Ministry of Transport and Highways and Urban Development stated that, due to the destruction of roads and bridges caused by the disaster situation that occurred across the island, it has been preliminarily estimated that the Road Development Authority has incurred a loss of approximately Rs. 75 billion.

title: Former Minister C.B. Rathnayake granted bail
byline: Former Minister C. B. Rathnayake, who was remanded following his arrest by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) over an investigation, has been granted bail.

title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island today
byline: Under the influence of the Easterly wave flow affecting the weather over the island, the prevailing showery conditions over the Northern and Eastern provinces are expected to continue during the next few days, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: All schools in Uva Province to reopen on December 29 - Secretary
byline: A decision has been taken to reopen all schools in the Uva Province on December 29, the Secretary to the Ministry of Education, Nalaka Kaluwewe said.

title: Trump sues the BBC for defamation over editing of January 6 speech
byline: President Donald Trump sued the BBC on Monday for defamation over edited clips of a speech that made it appear he directed supporters to storm the U.S. Capitol, opening an international front in his fight against media coverage he deems untrue or unfair.

title: Cabinet approves signing MoUs between several Sri Lankan and foreign universities
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to enter into Memoranda of Understanding between a number of Sri Lankan and Foreign Universities.

title: Landslide warnings issued for several districts extended; Red alerts lifted
byline: Early landslide warnings issued for several districts have been extended, after considering the current ground conditions and recent rainfall received in parts of the island.

title: Budget of NPP-led Balapitiya Pradeshiya Sabha defeated
byline: The inaugural budget of the Balapitiya Pradeshiya Sabha, where the National People’s Power (NPP) holds power, has been defeated.

title: Draft National Electricity Policy presented to Energy Minister
byline: The draft National Electricity Policy has been presented to Minister of Energy, Engineer Kumara Jayakody.

title: Rs. 25,000 relief allowance already disbursed to 50% of affected people – Minister
byline: The Rs. 25,000 relief allowance has been already disbursed to more than 50% of the people who were affected by recent floods and landslides, Cabinet Spokesperson and Minister of Health and Mass Media, Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa stated.

title: Australia police says Bondi attack gunmen travelled to Philippines
byline: Australian police said on Tuesday that the two alleged gunmen behind the mass shooting at Sydney’s Bondi Beach travelled to the Philippines last month, and that the reasons for their trip were under investigation.

title: Death toll from Bolivia floods rises to 20; at least two dozen missing
byline: The death toll in Bolivia from floods triggered by an overflowing river in the eastern Santa Cruz region has climbed to 20 and is expected to rise as rescue teams reach previously inaccessible areas, Deputy Civil Defense Minister Alfredo Troche said on Monday.

title: Paddy Marketing Board to release rice stocks through Sathosa and cooperative network
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to process paddy stocks purchased by the Paddy Marketing Board (PMB) and release the rice to the market.

title: Musk’s net worth hits $600 billion, Forbes says, as SpaceX preps for IPO
byline: Elon Musk on Monday became the first person ever worth $600 billion, Forbes said, on the heels of reports that his SpaceX startup was likely to go public at a valuation of $800 billion.

title: Case against Shasheendra Rajapaksa to be taken up in March 2026
byline: The bribery case filed against former State Minister Shasheendra Rajapaksa, who is currently out on bail after being produced before court, will be taken up again on March 13, 2026, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Cabinet approves expansion of storage facilities for Medical Supply Division
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to the proposal to enhance storage facilities for the Medical Supply Division under the Ministry of Health and Mass Media.

title: Parliament likely to meet on Dec. 18 and 19 - Cabinet Spokesman
byline: The government is hoping to hold Parliamentary sittings on Thursday (18) and Friday (19), Cabinet Spokesman Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa noted.

title: 25 Sri Lankans rescued from cybercrime centers in Myanmar repatriated
byline: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Bangkok, in close collaboration with the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, and the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Myanmar, has successfully facilitated the rescue and repatriation of 25 Sri Lankan nationals who had been trafficked in cybercrime centers in Myawaddy, Myanmar.

title: New National Cricket Selection Committee appointed
byline: Pramodya Wickramasinghe has been appointed as the Chairman of the National Cricket Selection Committee, the Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports stated.

title: Announcement regarding Ministry directive on Third Term Tests
byline: The Ministry of Education, Higher Education, and Vocational Education has reiterated its directive prohibiting the conduct of third-term school examinations for students in Grades 6 to 10 for the 2025 academic year.

title: Police Sergeant interdicted over close contact with ‘Duplicate Sewwandi’
byline: A Police Sergeant has been interdicted for allegedly maintaining close contact with a female suspect, Nanda Kumar Thakshee, who is currently being held under a 90-day detention order in connection with the murder of underworld figure Sanjeewa Kumara Samararatne, also known as ‘Ganemulla Sanjeewa,’ at the Aluthkade court complex.

title: Govt. grants special leave to state officials affected by Cyclone Ditwah
byline: The government has decided to grant special leave to state officials who were unable to report to work due to floods, landslides, and road blockages.

title: Dayasiri directs letter to SLFP General Secretary claiming party constitution has been violated
byline: Convening the Executive Committee and the All-Island Working Committee of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) constitutes a violation of the party’s constitution, according to Parliamentarian Dayasiri Jayasekara.

title: Turkey bound flight attempts to re-land at BIA due to technical issue
byline: A Turkey bound flight with 202 passengers which took off from the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) preparing to re-land due to a technical issue.

title: EU humanitarian aid worth EUR 500,000 arrives in Sri Lanka
byline: A special cargo flight carrying 69,000 kilograms of disaster relief humanitarian aid, valued at around EUR 500,000, arrived at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake early this morning (17) from Germany and Luxembourg.

title: 15-hour water cut in Mahara and Gampaha today
byline: A 15-hour water cut will be in effect for residents of Mahara and Gampaha from 4:00 p.m. today, the National Water Supply and Drainage Board has announced.

title: Harsha reiterates ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’ Fund should be approved by Parliament as statutory fund
byline: The ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’ Fund should be approved by Parliament as a statutory fund, the Chairman of the Committee on Public Finance, Parliamentarian Dr. Harsha de Silva reiterates.

title: Rob and Michele Reiner’s son Nick charged with murder in parents’ deaths
byline: Prosecutors in Los Angeles have filed murder charges against Nick Reiner over the deaths of his parents, Hollywood director Rob Reiner and his wife Michele.

title: Individual hacked to death in Matugama, area residents set fire to suspect’s house
byline: An individual has been hacked to death in Matugama following the escalation of a personal dispute.

title: Oil prices jumps as Trump orders blockade of sanctioned oil tankers leaving, entering Venezuela
byline: Oil prices climbed sharply on Wednesday after U.S. President Donald Trump ordered “a total and complete” blockade of all sanctioned oil tankers entering and leaving Venezuela, raising fresh geopolitical tensions at a time of concerns over demand.

title: PM Harini assures to address salary concerns of govt translators
byline: Officials of the Government Translators’ Service Union met with Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya at the Prime Minister’s Office to discuss several issues including salary concerns.

title: Doctors at Anuradhapura Hospital launch strike citing lack of adequate security
byline: Doctors attached to the Anuradhapura Teaching Hospital have launched a strike, citing the lack of adequate security.

title: Probe launched to arrest person responsible for torturing and setting fire to wild elephant in Mihintale
byline: Investigations have been launched into a video circulating on social media that allegedly shows a man torturing and setting fire to a wild elephant in the Ambagahawala area of Seeppukulama, Mihintale, according to the Department of Wildlife Conservation.

title: Govt extends pension payment period for farmers affected by Cyclone Ditwah
byline: The government has decided to extend the payment period for farmer pensions until December 31 considering the impact caused by the cyclone Ditwah in Sri Lanka.

title: 75kg of Kerala cannabis seized from boat in Maradankerni
byline: An individual has been taken into custody near a forested area along the Manalkadu, Maradankerni coastline with a stock of Kerala cannabis.

title: Miss Finland is stripped of her crown for making ‘racist’ slanted eye gesture
byline: Miss Finland has been stripped of her crown after she made a ‘racist’ slanted eye gesture in a social media post saying she was ‘eating with a Chinese person’.

title: Japanese bride weds AI groom after breaking off her engagement; ChatGPT persona proposed to her
byline: In a unique ceremony that signals the deepening emotional bonds between humans and artificial intelligence, a Japanese woman, Yurina Noguchi, recently married an AI-generated persona named Lune Klaus Verdure.

title: IMF Executive Board to review Sri Lanka’s US$ 200 million emergency financing request on Friday
byline: The Executive Board of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) is scheduled to review the government’s request for emergency financial assistance amounting to approximately USD 200 million under the Rapid Financing Instrument on Friday (19), according to the IMF Executive Board calendar.

title: Naveed Akram charged with 15 counts of murder over Bondi shooting
byline: Naveed Akram, the surviving suspect in Sunday’s mass shooting at Bondi Beach in Sydney, has been charged with 59 offences, including 15 counts of murder and one of committing a terrorist act, according to the New South Wales Police.

title: Missing yellow anaconda hatchling found at Dehiwala Zoo
byline: The Yellow Anaconda hatchling which was reported missing from the Dehiwala National Zoological Gardens recently, has been recovered.

title: Police constable taken into custody with ‘Ice’ while in uniform
byline: A police constable attached to the Dematagoda Police has been arrested in Dematagoda by officers of the Police Narcotics Bureau.

title: FM accepts US$ 2.5 million grant assistance from Japan
byline: Minister of Foreign Affairs Vijitha Herath today accepted the US$ 2.5 million grant assistance from the Government of Japan.

title: China reaffirms full support for Sri Lanka’s economic and social development
byline: The visiting Vice Chairman of the National People’s Congress of China, Wang Dongming called on President Anura Kumara Dissanayake at the Presidential Secretariat this morning (17).

title: Prison officers fire warning shots to prevent inmates from escaping Galle Prison
byline: Prison officers fired warning shots into the air after two remand inmates at the Galle Prison attempted to escape.

title: Indian film ‘Homebound’ shortlisted for Best International Feature Film at Oscars 2026
byline: The Indian movie ‘Homebound’, directed by Neeraj Ghaywan, has been shortlisted for the 98th Academy Awards in the Best International Feature Film category.

title: Turkey-bound aircraft forced to make emergency landing at BIA undergoing maintenance work – official
byline: A Turkish Airlines flight, which was forced to make an emergency landing at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) due to a technical fault, is scheduled to depart for Istanbul, Turkey, at 10:00 p.m. tomorrow (18), according to the airline’s official website. more..

title: Govt to present Rs. 500B supplementary sum to Parliament tomorrow
byline: A Supplementary estimate of Rs. 500 billion is to be presented to the Parliament tomorrow (18) to restore the livelihoods of those affected due to the sudden disaster situation.

title: France’s Louvre museum remains shut as workers weigh strike extension
byline: Paris’ Louvre, the world’s most-visited museum, remained closed at 0800 GMT on Wednesday, as its staff continued discussions on whether to extend a strike over pay and working conditions that started on Monday.

title: Strike launched after doctor at Badulla Teaching Hospital was assaulted by three-wheeler driver
byline: A doctor at the Badulla Teaching Hospital has reportedly been assaulted by a three-wheeler driver.

title: Two including 2-yr-old killed in fatal accident at Dehiattakandiya
byline: A 33‑year‑old woman and her 2‑year‑old son have died following a head‑on collision involving a bus and a three‑wheeler in the Muwagammana area in the Dehiattakandiya Police Division on the Polonnaruwa -Mahiyanganaya main road today (17).

title: Turkish Airlines flight forced to turn back after technical issue departs BIA
byline: The Turkish Airlines flight which was forced to make an emergency landing at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake due a technical issue with the landing gear, has departed from the BIA after the completion of repairs.

title: Heavy showers above 100mm likely in several provinces - Met Dept.
byline: The prevailing showery conditions are expected to continue over the Northern and Eastern parts of the island due to the influence of the Easterly wave, the Department of Meteorology stated.

title: Sri Lanka forecasts 5% growth in 2026, aided by post-cyclone reconstruction
byline: Sri Lanka expects its economy to expand by more than 5% next year, matching this year’s pace and significantly outstripping IMF projections, partly driven by reconstruction efforts following Cyclone Ditwah, a senior minister told Reuters on Wednesday.

title: Canada to provide over USD 2 million in humanitarian assistance to Sri Lanka
byline: Canada has announced more than USD 2 million in humanitarian aid to support emergency relief efforts in Sri Lanka following the devastation caused by Cyclone Ditwah, which resulted in loss of life and extensive damage to houses, infrastructure and local economies.

title: Suspect in ‘Ganemulla Sanjeewa’ murder released on bail
byline: Colombo Chief Magistrate Asanka S. Bodaragama today (17) granted bail to a suspect who had been arrested and remanded in custody in connection with the murder of underworld figure Sanjeewa Kumara Samararatne, also known as ‘Ganemulla Sanjeewa’.

title: Delhi restricts vehicles, office attendance in bid to curb pollution
byline: Authorities in India’s capital Delhi rolled out strict measures on Wednesday in an attempt to curb pollution, including a ban on vehicles not compliant with latest emission control norms and regulating attendance in private and government offices.

title: IOM appeals for $7.3 million to support cyclone-affected communities in Sri Lanka
byline: The International Organization for Migration (IOM) has launched an appeal for USD 7.3 million to support more than 100,000 people affected by Cyclone Ditwah in Sri Lanka, where the storm has displaced over 280,000 people and damaged or destroyed more than 81,000 homes,...
